conbody.p: Users are subsets of accounts and are added to accounts by an appropriately credentialed administrator. While the term user typically refers to a specific person, in Eucalyptus, a user is defined by a specific set of credentials generated to enable access to a given account. Each set of user credentials is valid for accessing only the account for which they were created. Thus a user only has access to one account within a Eucalyptus system. If an individual person wishes to have access to more than one account within a Eucalyptus system, a separate set of credentials must be generated (in effect a new ‘user’) for each account (though the same username and password can be used for different accounts).
